summary: Email correspondence between Jay Lefkowitz and Alex Acosta regarding revisions to a letter and addendum to be sent to Judge Davis in the Epstein case. The email includes attachments of revised documents and requests approval and execution of an addendum.

persons.name: Jay Lefkowitz
persons.context: Recipient of the email, involved in reviewing and approving a revised letter and addendum related to the Epstein case before it is sent to Judge Davis.

persons.name: Alex Acosta
persons.context: Sender of the email (from address AAcosta@usa.doj.gov), providing revised documents (letter and addendum) to Jay Lefkowitz for approval regarding the Epstein case, with plans to contact Judge Davis.

persons.name: Judge Davis
persons.context: Intended recipient of a letter and addendum related to the Epstein case, to be contacted by Alex Acosta after approval from Jay Lefkowitz.

connections.description: Collaborating on legal documents (letter and addendum) related to the Epstein case, with Acosta sending revisions to Lefkowitz for approval.
Acosta plans to contact Judge Davis and send him a letter and addendum regarding the Epstein case after approval from Lefkowitz.

events.title: Email Exchange on Epstein Case Documents
events.description: Alex Acosta emails Jay Lefkowitz with revised documents (a letter and addendum) related to the Epstein case, requesting approval before contacting Judge Davis.

keyFacts: The email is dated October 24, 2007, and involves U.S. Attorney Alex Acosta and attorney Jay Lefkowitz discussing the Epstein case.
Revised documents include a letter and an addendum intended for Judge Davis, with changes such as renumbering paragraphs to 7A, 7B, and 7C.
Acosta requests Lefkowitz to approve the documents, execute the addendum, and send it via PDF and FedEx, indicating ongoing legal coordination in the case.
